frame.name: Labeling
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> uses as a <fen>Label</fen> to refer to an <fen>Entity</fen>. The <fen>Label</fen> is not a conventional name for the <fen>Entity</fen> but a description categorizing the <fen>Entity</fen> and thereby expressing a judgment.
<ex><fex name="spe">Some</fex> <t>labeled</t> <fex name="ent">him</fex> <fex name="lab">a womanizer</fex>.</ex>
<ex>During her lifetime, <fex name="Speaker">her enemies</fex> <t>branded</t> <fex name="Entity">her</fex> <fex name="Label">as a prostitute</fex>. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who conventionally uses a linguistic sign to refer to an <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="spe">They</fex> <t>call</t> it a Mutt Mitt.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concrete or abstract thing with which the <fen>Speaker</fen> has associated a particular linguistic sign.
<ex>He <t>termed</t> <fex name="ent">it</fex> "a pretty incredible discovery" on par with two other 10,000- to 11,000-year-old specimens</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Label
FE.definition:
<def-root>The linguistic sign that the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses to designate the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>In Texas, we <t>call</t> it <fex name="lab">walking"</fex>.</ex> <ex>Americans <t>call</t> it <fex name="lab">a faucet</fex>. What do the British call it ?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>A time period in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Label</fen>.
<ex><fex name="tim">Back in the olden days</fex>, they <t>called</t> it "Bohemian people."</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A physical space whose occupants use the <fen>Label</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>I really loved this movie. <fex name="Place">In France</fex>, they <t>called</t> it "Turbo Interceptor".</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>A text whose author applies a particular <fen>Label</fen> to an <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="med">Your article</fex> <t>labels</t> him "Republican Senator Jim Exon".</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration_of_final_state
FE.definition: <def-root>Duration_of_final_state denotes the length of time from the beginning of a state resulting from the activity denoted by the target until the state no longer holds. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: label.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assign to a category, especially inaccurately.

lexUnit.name: call.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: use a particular name or description to refer to

lexUnit.name: term.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply a specified label to

lexUnit.name: brand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: mark out as having a particular shameful quality:
